USDA Forest Service, Chugach National Forest, Cordova Ranger District
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (USFWG), Alaska Department of Fish and Game (ADF&G)
citeinfo.title: Dusky Canada Goose Survey - Copper River

descript.abstract: Data Type: Birds; This data set contains aerial survey data for Dusky Canada Geese started on the Copper River Delta in 1986. Since that time the same transects have been sampled yearly. Population index and breeding pair index were calculated from the data. Winter numbers are counted from aerial photography on their wintering grounds in the Pacific Northwest and annual nest surveys are conducted on the Copper River Delta, Gulf of Alaska and Middleton Island. The purpose of this data is to monitor Dusky Canada Goose populations as indicators of habitat health and more broadly as indicator of diversity.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
